categories.title: ElizaOS Development Updates and Technical Discussions (January 6-7, 2026)

content.text:
## Discord Plugin Issues and Fixes

A user (DigitalDiva) encountered persistent issues with the Discord plugin not detecting server IDs, usernames, or server ownership despite proper configuration. The error "No server ID found 10" was traced to version compatibility issues between ElizaOS 1.7.0 and plugin-discord 1.3.3. Odilitime identified the problem as a transition from `serverId` to `messageServerId` in the codebase and created a fix branch (odi-17) to address bootstrap actions/providers issues. A formal PR (#6333) was submitted to fix plugin-bootstrap and SQL minor actions/providers for serverId compatibility. The team recommended users experiencing similar issues either wait for the fix or temporarily use version 1.6.5.

## New Contributor Onboarding

A blockchain and AI engineer (aicodeflow.dev) joined the community expressing interest in contributing to ElizaOS, particularly around agent autonomy with constraints, onchain execution layers with guardrails, prediction markets/event-driven systems, and observability tooling. Odilitime welcomed them and suggested starting by reading the code and working on plugins from github.com/elizaos-plugins/. The contributor was also encouraged to connect with Kenk for potential collaboration, with plans for open sessions in the near future. The team emphasized ElizaOS's plugin-based architecture as an entry point for new developers.

## Database Migration Issues

A developer encountered destructive migration errors when running `elizaos start` a second time, with the system blocking changes that would drop columns in the database. The error message indicated: "Destructive migration blocked - set ELIZA_ALLOW_DESTRUCTIVE_MIGRATIONS=true or use force option." The workaround of deleting the `.eliza` folder worked but wasn't ideal. Community helper stackweaver provided a solution: explicitly allow migrations by setting `ELIZA_ALLOW_DESTRUCTIVE_MIGRATIONS=true elizaos start`, noting this is safe for local development but requires careful review for production. Omid Sa also recommended using `elizaos dev` command instead of `elizaos start` for continuous monitoring during development.

## Token Contract Address Visibility Discussion

Community members raised concerns about the difficulty of finding official ElizaOS contract addresses (CA) across team-managed X accounts. The discussion highlighted that most users struggle to locate the correct CA within 10 seconds on the website or Twitter. Shaw acknowledged the issue and committed to addressing it, stating "we'll get on it." Kenk challenged the approach by asking for examples of top 50 projects with CA in their X bio or pinned tweets, suggesting this isn't standard practice. The team indicated they're refreshing their Linktree to point to CoinGecko for easier token information access. Broccolex emphasized that while a pinned tweet might not be the solution, the current flow doesn't work for most people.

## Core Development Updates

The core development team made several significant updates:

- Odilitime created PR #6333 to fix plugin-bootstrap issues with serverId compatibility, noting the team should rush out a release with this fix
- Stan submitted PRs for unified messaging API implementation for both Telegram (#22) and Discord (#41) plugins
- Stan prepared an RFC document on Hybrid Architecture with Persistent Workers for team review
- Discussion around Cursor AI revealed that using your own Claude API key doesn't provide the Cursor-optimized version of Claude
- The team shared GitHub's agentic workflows documentation as a reference for automation patterns
- Jin shared the team's HackMD workspace at https://hackmd.io/@elizaos/book

Odilitime also recommended reviewing the Jeju cloud branch for Shaw's preferred implementation of the Discord bridge, emphasizing the need for simple event pumps that can scale with multiple daemon instances per service.

## Cloud Infrastructure and Performance Optimization

Stan provided updates on cloud infrastructure work, focusing on:
- Fixes to handle TOCTOU (Time-of-check to time-of-use) race conditions using a deduct-before, reconcile-after approach
- Runtime initialization optimizations to improve performance
- Multiple PRs planned after deeper testing and validation
- Related tickets added to Linear for tracking

The team discussed the need for individual gateways for problematic connectors, with Odilitime suggesting simple event pumps as the direction. He noted that due to scale requirements, multiple daemon instances per service will be needed, with voice connections requiring higher priority/bandwidth event pumps than text. The emphasis was on having scaling plans without premature optimization.

## Community Integrations and Partnerships

Several integration and partnership discussions occurred:

- AlleyBoss shared an updated x402 protocol library for ElizaOS integration: `npm i @alleyboss/micropay-solana-x402-paywall`
- HackMD's marketing team reached out expressing support for ElizaOS builders using their platform
- Voidix representative sought to connect with the team regarding liquidity management and market making partnerships
- Discussion about Rumble's acquisition of Northern Data's GPUs and data centers for cloud services and AI
- Community speculation about market movements and "silent load up from big money"

The team also addressed confusion about Babylon (a16z investment) being unrelated to ElizaOS.

## Migration and Token Questions

Several community members had questions about token migration:

- Users asked about buying AI16Z now and migrating to ElizaOS after 30 days, with confusion about the 6:1 ratio and potential returns
- Omid Sa clarified that purchases made after the November 11 snapshot cannot be migrated
- Questions arose about token utility in the new version and whether it accrues value for holders
- One user expressed concern about Shaw's comments on creator coins after making a YouTube video about the project

The team emphasized checking the migration support channel for detailed information.

Issue #6332 reports a performance problem where Turbo build is consuming excessive memory, reaching 21GB or more. This memory consumption issue was reported by madjin and needs investigation to optimize resource usage during the build process.

Issue #6331 describes a bug where a "Model not found" error occurs when using agent ID with API endpoints. This issue, also reported by madjin, indicates a problem with the API's ability to properly recognize or handle agent IDs in endpoint requests.

During the period from January 6 to January 7, 2026, the elizaos/eliza repository showed minimal development activity. There were no new pull requests created or merged during this timeframe. However, the repository did see 2 new issues opened, indicating some user engagement or bug reports. The project had 2 active contributors participating during these two days.
sources: From 2026-01-06 to 2026-01-07, elizaos/eliza had 0 new PRs (0 merged), 2 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

content.text: This topic focuses on the top contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project. However, the provided source does not contain specific information about who the contributors are, their contribution statistics, or details about their involvement in the project. To provide accurate information about the top contributors, the source would need to include data such as contributor names, number of commits, lines of code contributed, or other relevant metrics.
